Package com.mygdx.gigabiteconomy.sprites.tiled

Class MovingSprite

java.lang.Object
com.mygdx.gigabiteconomy.sprites.GameObject
com.mygdx.gigabiteconomy.sprites.tiled.TiledObject
com.mygdx.gigabiteconomy.sprites.tiled.MovingSprite
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Disposable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Enemy, Player
public abstract class MovingSprite
extends TiledObject
implements com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Disposable
Class representing a sprite shown on screen, ready to be drawn with batch.draw(); in MainScreen class. Sprite has ability to move tiles and launch attacks/be attacked. MainScreen interfaces with this class through GameObject.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    static class  MovingSprite.DIRECTION
    Enum which maps direction to velocity vector with instance variables defined above
    static class  MovingSprite.Weapon

    • updateTextureRegions

      public void updateTextureRegions​(MovingSprite.DIRECTION directionFacing)
      Update the sprite's texture regions (texture atlases being shown as the sprite) based on its directionFacing & weapon. Called when directionFacing or weapon is changed.

    • move

      public boolean move​(float delta) throws TileMovementException
      Method to handle general MovingSprite movement Attacks if boolean set and moves the sprite in direction of directionMoving Implementation notes: -> setNextDirection() abstract method defines path of MovingSprite -> Can be extended by overriding and calling super on this method -> When a sprite is moving, two Tiles are occupied. Moving to and moving from.
      Parameters:
      delta -
      Returns:
      True: Arrived at next tile ; False: Currently moving
      Throws:
      TileMovementException

    • setWeapon

      public void setWeapon​(MovingSprite.Weapon weapon)
      Set the sprite's current weapon
      Parameters:
      weapon - the weapon the sprite is to carry

    • launchAttack

      public void launchAttack()
      Launch an attack using the sprite's weapon. Will call attack() and detract from health of any surrounding sprite.

    • attack

      public void attack​(MovingSprite.Weapon weapon)
      Attack the sprite; called when another sprite launches an attack within range of the sprite. Deducts -5 * hit multiplier of used weapon from sprite's health.
      Parameters:
      weapon - the weapon the attacking sprite is currently carrying

    • setHealth

      public void setHealth​(int health)
      Set the health of the sprite
      Parameters:
      health - the sprite's new health value

    • isAttacking

      public boolean isAttacking()
      Get if the sprite is attacking
      Returns:
      if attacking (true => attacking; false => not attacking)

    • setAttacking

      public void setAttacking​(boolean attacking)
      Set if the sprite is attacking
      Parameters:
      attacking - if attacking (true => attacking; false => not attacking)

    • getHealth

      public int getHealth()
      Get the sprite's health
      Returns:
      the sprite's health (as a percentage i.e. out of 100)

    • destroy

      public abstract void destroy()
      Destroy the sprite. Called when the sprite's health reaches 0 or less.

    • dispose

      public void dispose()
      Remove the sprite's texture atlas from memory once the sprite is no longer needed
